Package gov.tak.api.commons.graphics

Class Bitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.api.commons.graphics.Bitmap
  • public final class Bitmap
extends java.lang.Object
    Raster graphic represented by matrix of ARGB pixels.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Bitmap​(int[] argb, int offset, int stride, int width, int height)
      Create a bitmap with specified ARGB color values.

      Create a bitmap with specified ARGB color values.
      Bitmap​(int width, int height)
      Create a bitmap with a specified width and height.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap​(int width,
              int height)
        Create a bitmap with a specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - number of pixels per row
        height - number of pixels per column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height <= 0

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap​(int[] argb,
              int offset,
              int stride,
              int x,
              int y,
              int sourceWidth,
              int sourceHeight,
              int width,
              int height)
        Create a bitmap with specified ARGB color values.
        Parameters:
        argb - the ARGB color values to write to the bitmap
        offset - the index of the first color to read from argb[]
        stride - the number of argb[] elements to skip between rows (positive OR negative)
        x - the x coordinate of the first pixel to copy to the origin pixel of the bitmap
        y - the y coordinate of the first pixel to copy to the origin pixel of the bitmap
        sourceWidth - number of pixels per row to copy from the source argb[]
        sourceHeight - number of pixels per column to copy from the source argb[]
        width - number of pixels per row of the bitmap
        height - number of pixels per column of the bitmap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height <= 0
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - – if the pixels array is too small to index according to offset, stride, x, y, width and height parameters

      • Bitmap

        public Bitmap​(int[] argb,
              int offset,
              int stride,
              int width,
              int height)
        Create a bitmap with specified ARGB color values.
        Parameters:
        argb - the ARGB color values to write to the bitmap
        offset - the index of the first color to read from argb[]
        stride - the number of argb[] elements to skip between rows (positive OR negative)
        width - number of pixels per row of the bitmap
        height - number of pixels per column of the bitmap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height <= 0
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - – if the pixels array is too small to index according to offset, stride, x, y, width and height parameters

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the number of pixels per row
        Returns:
        positive integer indicating number of pixels per row

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the number of pixels per column
        Returns:
        positive integer indicating number of pixels per column

      • getPixel

        public int getPixel​(int x,
                    int y)
        Get the ARGB color value of a pixel at a given x, y coordinate
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the pixel
        y - the y coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        the ARGB color value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x, y exceed the bitmap's bounds

      • getPixels

        public void getPixels​(int[] argb,
                      int offset,
                      int stride,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int width,
                      int height)
        Returns in argb[] a copy of the data in the bitmap.
        Parameters:
        argb - the array to receive the bitmap's colors
        offset - the first index to write into argb[]
        stride - the number of entries in pixels[] to skip between rows (must be >= bitmap's width). Can be negative.
        x - the x coordinate of the first pixel to read from the bitmap
        y - the y coordinate of the first pixel to read from the bitmap
        width - the number of pixels to read from each row
        height - the number of rows to read
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x, y, width, height exceed the bounds of the bitmap, or if abs(stride) < width.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the pixels array is too small to receive the specified number of pixels.

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel​(int x,
                     int y,
                     int argb)
        Write the specified ARGB color value into the bitmap at the x,y coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the pixel to replace (0...width-1)
        y - the y coordinate of the pixel to replace (0...height-1)
        argb - the ARGB color value to write into the bitmap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x, y are outside of the bitmap's bounds.

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels​(int[] argb,
                      int offset,
                      int stride,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int width,
                      int height)
        Replace pixels in the bitmap with the colors in the array.
        Parameters:
        argb - the ARGB color values to write to the bitmap
        offset - the index of the first color to read from argb[]
        stride - the number of colors in pixels[] to skip between rows.
        x - the x coordinate of the first pixel to write to in the bitmap.
        y - the y coordinate of the first pixel to write to in the bitmap.
        width - the number of colors to copy from argb[] per row
        height - the number of rows to write to the bitmap
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x, y, width, height are outside of the bitmap's bounds.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the pixels array is too small to receive the specified number of pixels.
